description.narrative: Objective: Communities in Artibonite Department are more resilient to hazard because DPC members at all levels of government (department, commune, sub-commune) demonstrate ability to carry out timely, appropriate, and effective responses with hazard-affected communes.

The scope of the program will be to build capacity of departmental-level Civil Protection Departments (Directions de la Protection Civile – DPCs) with (A) institutional support while complementing the current efforts of the GoH and international community, notably OFDA, USAID/Haiti, and SOUTHCOM and (B) a rapid response mechanism for helping meet urgent needs following a disaster in the department. The project will fall under OFDA’s Risk Management Policy and Practice sector and both the Capacity Building/Training and Building Community Awareness/Mobilization subsectors.
The key direct beneficiaries of the program will be the Departmental Technical Coordinators (CTDs – Coordinateur Technique Departemental), the Delegués, other government officials, and the volunteers working with the DPC in the departments where projects will be funded. While there will likely be support to the central and communal levels, this program will be focused on supporting the departmental-level stakeholders. Indirect beneficiaries include those impacted by natural disasters and events in the selected departments who will receive improved assistance coordinated by the DPC.
KKRD-Latibonit focuses specifically on increasing DPC capacity at the department and commune level in Artibonite where Mercy Corps has been implementing programs since 2010 (as have many other NGOs). As post-earthquake revenues have dried up, many of those INGOs have left Artibonite – one of the most hazard prone departments in Haiti. To protect the development advances of the last few years, this program aims to increase the government’s capacity for Disaster Risk Reduction (DRR) and emergency response.
